msContents.summary: The text, which is objectively phrased, provides for the four-year leasing of four and a half arouras near the Oxyrhynchite village of Kerkeura, for agricultural use. Neither lessor, Harthonis son of Sarapas, nor the lessee, Onnophris, who is designated Perses tes epigones and whose patronymic is lost, can be readily recognized. The rate of rent, the usual guaranties and possibly other provisions have been lost.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

condition.ab: The papyrus is medium to dark brown, roughly rectangular and coarsely made. Gaps were left between some horizontal fibers, with the result that writing is sometimes found on the vertical layer. About 2 cm. from the right edge is a kollesis, to the right of which letters have been lost from most, or all, lines (see line 8). At the bottom the papyrus is nearly intact, with margins of about 2 cm. surviving at the left and top. There are three horizontal folds, about 2 cm. apart.

handDesc.p: The ink is black but not very dark, and has rubbed away almost entirely in the region just to the left of the kollesis. The scribe wrote quickly, in a clear but graceless hand with few ligatures and a slight rightward slant. The script is similar to, but less elegant than, the hands of P. Oxy. X 1231 and XXVI 2441 (E. G. Turner, Greek Manuscripts of the Ancient World, Oxford 1971, pl. 17). The writer observed carefully the verticality of the left edge of the column of writing and maintained reasonably straight lines.

div.ab: "Harthonis, son of Sarapas, grandson of . . . from the Oxyrhynchite nome, has leased to Onnophris, son of . . ., mother Apollonias, daughter of Apolloni[ , from the same city and Persian of the epigone, for four years from the current fouth year of Antoninus Caesar Our Lord, the four and a half arouras of land which he owns in the vicinity of Kerkeura for him to sow cereals and fodder every year . . ." (TC)
